project.name: standup-generator
project.description: CLI tool that generates professional standup updates by parsing git commit history across multiple repositories

milestones.name: Phase 1: Foundation
milestones.description: Project setup, core architecture, and basic git commit retrieval

milestones.name: Phase 2: Core Features
milestones.description: MVP implementation with intelligent parsing, multi-repo support, and output formatting

milestones.name: Phase 3: Polish & Launch
milestones.description: Error handling, documentation, testing, and NPM publication

issues.title: Initialize project with npm and folder structure
issues.body:
## Description

Set up the initial project structure following the package layout defined in the specification. This establishes the foundation for all subsequent development.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] npm init with appropriate package.json metadata
- [ ] Create folder structure: `bin/`, `src/`, `test/`
- [ ] Create placeholder files: `bin/standup.js`, `src/index.js`, `src/git.js`, `src/parser.js`, `src/formatter.js`, `src/utils.js`
- [ ] Add .gitignore for node_modules and common files
- [ ] Set `bin` field in package.json pointing to `bin/standup.js`
- [ ] Add shebang `#!/usr/bin/env node` to bin/standup.js

## Technical Notes

- Package name: `standup-generator`
- Use ES modules or CommonJS (decide based on preference)
- Set minimum Node.js version to 14+

## Resources

- [npm package.json docs](https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v10/configuring-npm/package-json)

issues.title: Install and configure core dependencies
issues.body:
## Description

Install the three core dependencies specified for the project: commander for CLI argument parsing, simple-git for git operations, and clipboardy for clipboard functionality.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Install `commander` as production dependency
- [ ] Install `simple-git` as production dependency
- [ ] Install `clipboardy` as production dependency
- [ ] Install dev dependencies: `jest` for testing
- [ ] Verify all packages install correctly on Node.js 14+
- [ ] Add test script to package.json

## Technical Notes

- Use latest stable versions of each package
- Consider adding `eslint` and `prettier` for code quality

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #1 (Project initialization)

issues.title: Set up CLI entry point with commander
issues.body:
## Description

Create the CLI entry point using commander with all specified flags and options. This establishes the command interface that users will interact with.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] CLI responds to `standup` command when linked locally
- [ ] `--since` flag accepts time range string (default: "24 hours ago")
- [ ] `--all-authors` flag is boolean, defaults to false
- [ ] `--copy` flag is boolean, defaults to false
- [ ] `-h` / `--help` shows usage information
- [ ] `-V` / `--version` shows package version
- [ ] Invalid flags show helpful error message

## Technical Notes

- Use commander's `.option()` for each flag
- Parse options and pass to main orchestration function
- Example: `standup --since "2 days ago" --all-authors --copy`

## Resources

- [Commander.js docs](https://github.com/tj/commander.js)

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #2 (Dependencies installed)

issues.title: Implement basic git commit retrieval for single repository
issues.body:
## Description

Create the core git functionality to retrieve commits from the current repository within a specified time range. This is the foundation of the entire tool.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Function `getCommits(options)` in `src/git.js`
- [ ] Retrieves commits from current working directory
- [ ] Respects `--since` time range parameter
- [ ] Returns array of commit objects with: hash, message, author, date
- [ ] Works with standard git repositories
- [ ] Handles repositories with no commits gracefully

## Technical Notes

- Use `simple-git` library
- `git.log()` method with `--since` option
- Return raw commit data; filtering happens in parser

## Resources

- [simple-git documentation](https://github.com/steveukx/git-js)

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #2 (Dependencies installed)

issues.title: Implement current git user detection and filtering
issues.body:
## Description

Add functionality to detect the current git user's email/name and filter commits to only show their work (default behavior).

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Function to get current git user email from git config
- [ ] Filter commits by author email by default
- [ ] When `--all-authors` is true, skip author filtering
- [ ] Handle case where git user is not configured
- [ ] Match author by email (more reliable than name)

## Technical Notes

- Use `simple-git` to read git config
- `git config user.email` equivalent
- Author matching should be case-insensitive

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #4 (Basic commit retrieval)

issues.title: Create time range parsing utility
issues.body:
## Description

Implement utility function in `src/utils.js` to parse human-readable time ranges into git-compatible date formats.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Parse "24 hours ago" (default)
- [ ] Parse "2 days ago"
- [ ] Parse "1 week ago"
- [ ] Parse day names like "Friday"
- [ ] Pass through already-valid git date formats
- [ ] Handle invalid inputs with helpful error

## Technical Notes

- Git's `--since` is flexible; most natural language works
- May be able to pass through to git directly
- Test edge cases around weekends/holidays

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #1 (Project setup)

issues.title: Implement merge commit filtering
issues.body:
## Description

Add filtering logic in `src/parser.js` to automatically remove merge commits from the output, keeping standup updates focused on actual work.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Filter out commits starting with "Merge branch"
- [ ] Filter out commits starting with "Merge pull request"
- [ ] Filter out commits matching common merge patterns
- [ ] Preserve all non-merge commits
- [ ] Case-insensitive matching

## Technical Notes

- Check commit message prefix
- Common patterns: `Merge branch`, `Merge pull request`, `Merge remote-tracking`
- Consider regex pattern for flexibility

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #4 (Basic commit retrieval)

issues.title: Implement conventional commit prefix parsing
issues.body:
## Description

Parse conventional commit prefixes (feat:, fix:, docs:, etc.) from commit messages to preserve them in the formatted output.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Detect `feat:` prefix and preserve it
- [ ] Detect `fix:` prefix and preserve it
- [ ] Detect `docs:` prefix and preserve it
- [ ] Detect `chore:` prefix and preserve it
- [ ] Detect `test:` prefix and preserve it
- [ ] Detect `refactor:` prefix and preserve it
- [ ] Handle commits without conventional prefix (show as-is)
- [ ] Handle scope syntax: `feat(auth):` etc.

## Technical Notes

- Regex pattern: `/^(feat|fix|docs|chore|test|refactor)(\([^)]+\))?:\s*/i`
- Don't require conventional commits; just parse when present
- Keep the prefix in output for categorization

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #4 (Basic commit retrieval)

issues.title: Implement commit message truncation
issues.body:
## Description

Add message truncation logic to keep commit messages readable at 80 characters, adding ellipsis for longer messages.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Truncate messages longer than 80 characters
- [ ] Add ellipsis (`...`) to truncated messages
- [ ] Preserve message intent (don't cut mid-word if possible)
- [ ] Count only the message body, not any prefixes added by formatter
- [ ] Messages at exactly 80 chars remain unchanged

## Technical Notes

- Consider word-boundary truncation for cleaner output
- Ellipsis counts toward the 80 character limit
- First line of commit message only (ignore body)

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #8 (Conventional commit parsing)

issues.title: Implement multi-repository detection
issues.body:
## Description

Add functionality to detect git repositories when the tool is run from a parent directory containing multiple repos. Scan one level deep only.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Detect if current directory is a git repository
- [ ] If not a repo, scan immediate subdirectories for `.git` folders
- [ ] Return list of detected repository paths with names
- [ ] Show message indicating which repos were found
- [ ] Handle case where no repos are found
- [ ] Only scan one level deep (not recursive)

## Technical Notes

- Check for `.git` directory existence
- Use `fs.readdir` to scan subdirectories
- Repository name = directory name

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #4 (Basic commit retrieval)

issues.title: Implement commit retrieval across multiple repositories
issues.body:
## Description

Extend git.js to retrieve commits from multiple detected repositories and aggregate the results.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Iterate through detected repositories
- [ ] Retrieve commits from each repo with same time range
- [ ] Apply same author filtering across all repos
- [ ] Associate commits with their repository name
- [ ] Handle repos with no commits in timeframe gracefully
- [ ] Aggregate results into single data structure

## Technical Notes

- Create simple-git instance per repository path
- Return structure: `{ repoName: [commits], ... }`
- Empty repos should appear in results but with empty array

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #10 (Multi-repo detection)
- Depends on: #5 (User filtering)

issues.title: Create basic markdown formatter for single repository
issues.body:
## Description

Implement the formatter module to generate markdown output for a single repository's commits.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Generate date header: "Yesterday (Dec 10, 2024):" format
- [ ] Generate bullet points for each commit
- [ ] No emojis in output (professional format)
- [ ] Commits appear as `• message` format
- [ ] Empty line after header
- [ ] Output is valid markdown

## Technical Notes

- Use bullet character `•` (Unicode) not `-` or `*`
- Date format: "Yesterday (Month DD, YYYY)" or "Last 2 days (Dec 9-10, 2024)"
- Handle single vs multiple day ranges

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #9 (Message truncation)

issues.title: Extend markdown formatter for multiple repositories
issues.body:
## Description

Extend the formatter to handle multiple repositories, grouping commits under repository name headers.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Repository name as subheader (no special formatting, just name:)
- [ ] Commits grouped under their repository
- [ ] Empty line between repository sections
- [ ] Skip repositories with no commits
- [ ] Single repo mode doesn't show repo name header
- [ ] Alphabetical ordering of repositories

## Technical Notes

- Format per spec:
  ```
  backend-api:
  • commit 1
  • commit 2
  
  frontend:
  • commit 1
  ```

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #12 (Single repo formatter)
- Depends on: #11 (Multi-repo commit retrieval)

issues.title: Implement clipboard copy functionality
issues.body:
## Description

Add the `--copy` flag functionality to copy the generated standup output to the system clipboard.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] When `--copy` flag is passed, copy output to clipboard
- [ ] Still print output to console when copying
- [ ] Show confirmation message: "Copied to clipboard!"
- [ ] Handle clipboard errors gracefully
- [ ] Works on macOS, Linux, and Windows

## Technical Notes

- Use `clipboardy` library
- `clipboardy.writeSync()` for synchronous copy
- Test on multiple platforms if possible

## Resources

- [clipboardy docs](https://github.com/sindresorhus/clipboardy)

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #13 (Multi-repo formatter)

issues.title: Wire up main orchestration in index.js
issues.body:
## Description

Connect all modules together in src/index.js to create the complete workflow from CLI input to formatted output.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Parse CLI options from commander
- [ ] Detect single or multi-repo mode
- [ ] Retrieve commits with appropriate filtering
- [ ] Process commits through parser
- [ ] Format output with formatter
- [ ] Handle copy flag if specified
- [ ] Return/print final output

## Technical Notes

- Main function should be async
- Export main function for testing
- Call from bin/standup.js

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #3 (CLI setup)
- Depends on: #14 (Clipboard copy)
- Depends on: #13 (Multi-repo formatter)

issues.title: Implement error handling for non-git directory
issues.body:
## Description

Add clear error messaging when the tool is run from a directory that is not a git repository and has no git repositories in subdirectories.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Clear error message: "Error: Not a git repository (or any parent/child directories)"
- [ ] Exit with non-zero status code
- [ ] Suggest user run from within a git repository
- [ ] Don't show stack trace to user
- [ ] Helpful hint about running from correct directory

## Technical Notes

- Check for git repo before attempting any operations
- Use process.exit(1) for error exit
- Consider colored output for error messages

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #15 (Main orchestration)

issues.title: Implement "no commits found" messaging
issues.body:
## Description

Add helpful messaging when no commits are found within the specified time range.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Show message: "No commits found in the last [time range]"
- [ ] If single repo: show repo name in message
- [ ] If multi-repo: list which repos were checked
- [ ] Suggest trying a different time range
- [ ] Exit with success (0) status, not error
- [ ] Don't show empty output format

## Technical Notes

- This is informational, not an error condition
- User might have legitimately had no commits
- Consider: "Try running with --since '1 week ago'" hint

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #15 (Main orchestration)

issues.title: Add repository detection status output
issues.body:
## Description

Show users which repositories were detected and processed before displaying the standup output.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Print "Found N repositories: repo1, repo2, ..."
- [ ] Show before standup output, not after
- [ ] In single-repo mode, show "Running in [repo-name]"
- [ ] Use subtle formatting (dim/gray if terminal supports it)
- [ ] Don't interfere with `--copy` functionality

## Technical Notes

- This is informational output, separate from the standup itself
- Only the standup content should be copied, not the status message
- Consider stderr for status, stdout for output

## Dependencies

- Depends on: #15 (Main orchestration)
